dublinCore.dc:title: 119 SJ 28 PCS: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to “Defining Larger Participants of a Market for General-Use Digital Consumer Payment Applications”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Ricketts (for himself, Mr. Budd, Mr. Banks, Mr. Hagerty, Mrs. Fischer, and Mr. Scott of South Carolina) introduced the following joint resolution; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs
Committee discharged, by petition, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. 802(c), and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to Defining Larger Participants of a Market for General-Use Digital Consumer Payment Applications.

section.text: That Congress disapproves the final rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to Defining Larger Participants of a Market for General-Use Digital Consumer Payment Applications (89 Fed. Reg. 99582 (December 10, 2024)), and such rule shall have no force or effect.

endorsement.action-desc: Committee discharged, by petition, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. 802(c), and placed on the calendar
